title: (x) juliepotvin.free.fr - Zebrawood Fill {Yves}
content:
the attached pic is of a font which is one of many used on [http://juliepotvin.free.fr/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040/http:/juliepotvin.free.fr/)   
but i'm not sure what it's name is, or who made it. any help would be greatly appriciated.   
-phillip   
 ![old timey font](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/11507.gif)
author: eightone

comments.content:
thanks! you guys are always quick on these things, muchly appriciated.   
   
-phillip

thanks yet again. Chris Ware is so freakin good, he combines my two favorite things (comics and typography). nice to be compared ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
-phillip

That's great, the opening to your site. Reminds me of the [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040/http:/happytreefriends.com/) site. Those cute little guys, getting all psycho on themselves! Beware candy!

YEAH! happy tree friends was created by a cool comic artist named Rhode Montijo, he draws a comic called [http://www.pablosinferno.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040/http:/www.pablosinferno.com/)   
He's a real nice guy in person too (which makes his demented mind even cooler).

It's Adobe's [Zebrawood Fill](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/F/ZEBQ/F_ZEBQ-10005090.jhtml).   
   
It's funny how the "fill" variants of those layered   
Tuscans and other wood types are so wildly popular   
without the actual "framework" designs. I've rarely   
seen [Rosewood](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/F/ROSQ/F_ROSQ-10005000.jhtml) in action as it was intended to be,   
but [Rosewood Fill](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/F/ROSQ/F_ROSQ-10005090.jhtml) just keeps popping up everywhere   
from CD covers and posters to websites.
Nice observation, Yves. I've pondered the same.

YRWLM Phillip. I'm sorry I noticed your post only this morning.   
You could've had your ID _wayyy_ sooner.   
   
P.S. I quite like the opening page to [your site](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040/http:/pw1.netcom.com/~phillip.cavette/). Reminds me of the   
 [Quimby the Mouse](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040/http:/quimby.gnus.org/warehouse/anl2/anl2.html) funnies by [Chris Ware](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040/http:/www.fantagraphics.com/artist/acme/acme.html). Or [Itchy and Scratchy](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024011040/http:/www.thesimpsons.com/bios/bios_townspeople_itchyandscratchy.html).   
Looks like that must hurt... =D

Tiff, the HappyTreeFriends are rad! I got the link sent to   
me by a friend a couple of months ago, and I wanted to   
show my kids as I thought these were meant for children   
Luckily I always sample stuff myself before I have my   
children watch... ;)
